docs.snippet: The Hamburg-American liner Blucher arrived yesterday after the first cruise ever made by a passenger vessel to South America. She was away eighty-one days, and her three hundred passengers went as far as the Strait of Magellan, visiting many out of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Hamburg-American liner Blucher arrived yesterday after the first cruise ever made by a passenger vessel to South America. She was away eighty-one days, and her three hundred passengers went as far as the Strait of Magellan, visiting many out of the way places.

headline.main: BRINGS BRYAN'S LLAMAS.; Pets Arrive on Bluecher -- Tourists Met Cook in the Andes.

docs.snippet: LONDON, May 28, (by telegraph to Clifden, Ireland; thence by wireless.) -- With the horse show opening only a week off and the classic Derby run next Wednesday, London, in spite of the shock to the season caused by King Edward's death, is in for a...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, May 28, (by telegraph to Clifden, Ireland; thence by wireless.) -- With the horse show opening only a week off and the classic Derby run next Wednesday, London, in spite of the shock to the season caused by King Edward's death, is in for a fairly gay three weeks.

headline.main: EFFORTS TO SAVE THE LONDON SEASON; Horse Show and the Derby Expected to Hold Visitors for a Few Weeks.

byline.original: By Marconi Transatlantic Wireless Telegraph to The New York Times

headline.main: HUGHES ON WAY TO CHICAGO.; Governor Cancels Engagements to Accompany Fuller Funeral Party.

docs.snippet: The British bark Invernessshire, with a good cargo, sailed away from Hamburg oil March 2, bound for Santa Rosalia, Cal. With every bit of canvas standing she crept down around the Spanish coast to Africa, where, taking advantage of the northeast...
docs.lead_paragraph: The British bark Invernessshire, with a good cargo, sailed away from Hamburg oil March 2, bound for Santa Rosalia, Cal. With every bit of canvas standing she crept down around the Spanish coast to Africa, where, taking advantage of the northeast trades, she crossed the Atlantic, passing the Cape Verde Islands and Cape St. Roque, on the east coast of South America.
docs.abstract: Brit bark Invernesshire, which left Hamburg Mar 2d, found anchored off Falkland Islands with cargo intact but capt and crew missing

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 17 -- The Consular and Trade Report will note the following trade opportunities abroad. Further information regarding these may be obtained by addressing the Bureau of Manufactures, care of the Department of Commerce and Labor....
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 17 -- The Consular and Trade Report will note the following trade opportunities abroad. Further information regarding these may be obtained by addressing the Bureau of Manufactures, care of the Department of Commerce and Labor. Washington, D.C., giving the number of item referred to.
